1: -module(jobforge_job_SUITE).
    2: -compile(export_all).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %%% In jobforge_job_SUITE.erl
    7: all() -> [multiple_roots, linear_chain, diamond, large_acyclic, large_cycle, simple_acyclic, simple_cycle, independent_chains, missing_dependency, empty_list, single_task, self_cycle].
    8: 
    9: multiple_roots(_Config) ->
   10:     Tasks = [
   11:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   12:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   13:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>, <<"B">>]}
   14:     ],
   15:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   16:     Result = jobforge_job:process(Input),
   17:     case Result of
   18:         {ok, Sorted} ->
   19:             Names = [maps:get(<<"name">>, T) || T <- Sorted],
   20:             case Names of
   21:                 [<<"A">>, <<"B">>, <<"C">>] -> ok;
   22:                 [<<"B">>, <<"A">>, <<"C">>] -> ok;
   23:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_order, Names})
   24:             end;
   25:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
   26:     end.
   27: 
   28: linear_chain(_Config) ->
   29:     Tasks = [
   30:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   31:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]},
   32:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>]}
   33:     ],
   34:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   35:     Result = jobforge_job:process(Input),
   36:     case Result of
   37:         {ok, [A, B, C]} ->
   38:             Names = [maps:get(<<"name">>, A), maps:get(<<"name">>, B), maps:get(<<"name">>, C)],
   39:             case Names of
   40:                 [<<"A">>, <<"B">>, <<"C">>] -> ok;
   41:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_order, Names})
   42:             end;
   43:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
   44:     end.
   45: 
   46: diamond(_Config) ->
   47:     Tasks = [
   48:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   49:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]},
   50:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]},
   51:         #{<<"name">> => <<"D">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo D">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>, <<"C">>]}
   52:     ],
   53:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   54:     Result = jobforge_job:process(Input),
   55:     case Result of
   56:         {ok, Sorted} ->
   57:             Names = [maps:get(<<"name">>, T) || T <- Sorted],
   58:             case Names of
   59:                 [<<"A">>, <<"B">>, <<"C">>, <<"D">>] -> ok;
   60:                 [<<"A">>, <<"C">>, <<"B">>, <<"D">>] -> ok;
   61:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_order, Names})
   62:             end;
   63:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
   64:     end.
   65: 
   66: simple_acyclic(_Config) ->
   67:     Tasks = [
   68:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   69:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]},
   70:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>]}
   71:     ],
   72:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   73:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
   74:     case Result of
   75:         {ok, Sorted} when length(Sorted) =:= 3 -> ok;
   76:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
   77:     end.
   78: 
   79: simple_cycle(_Config) ->
   80:     Tasks = [
   81:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>]},
   82:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]}
   83:     ],
   84:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   85:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
   86:     case Result of
   87:         {error, {cycle_detected, _}} -> ok;
   88:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
   89:     end.
   90: 
   91: independent_chains(_Config) ->
   92:     Tasks = [
   93:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   94:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]},
   95:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => []},
   96:         #{<<"name">> => <<"D">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo D">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"C">>]}
   97:     ],
   98:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
   99:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
  100:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [Result]),
  101:     case Result of
  102:         {ok, Sorted} when length(Sorted) =:= 4 -> ok;
  103:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: missing_dependency(_Config) ->
  107:     Tasks = [
  108:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>]}
  109:     ],
  110:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
  111:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
  112:     case Result of
  113:         {error, _} -> ok; % You may want to check for a specific error
  114:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  115:     end.
  116: 
  117: empty_list(_Config) ->
  118:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => []},
  119:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
  120:     case Result of
  121:         {ok, []} -> ok;
  122:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  123:     end.
  124: 
  125: single_task(_Config) ->
  126:     Tasks = [
  127:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => []}
  128:     ],
  129:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
  130:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
  131:     case Result of
  132:         {ok, [Task]} ->
  133:             case maps:get(<<"name">>, Task) of
  134:                 <<"A">> -> ok;
  135:                 _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  136:             end;
  137:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  138:     end.
  139: 
  140: self_cycle(_Config) ->
  141:     Tasks = [
  142:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]}
  143:     ],
  144:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
  145:     Result = task_sorter:sort(Input),
  146:     case Result of
  147:         {error, {cycle_detected, <<"A">>}} -> ok;
  148:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: large_cycle(_Config) ->
  152:     Tasks = [
  153:         #{<<"name">> => <<"A">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo A">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"B">>]},
  154:         #{<<"name">> => <<"B">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo B">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"C">>]},
  155:         #{<<"name">> => <<"C">>, <<"command">> => <<"echo C">>, <<"requires">> => [<<"A">>]}
  156:     ],
  157:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
  158:     Result = jobforge_job:process(Input),
  159:     case Result of
  160:         {error, _} -> ok;  % or {err, _} if that's your convention
  161:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  162:     end.
  163: 
  164: large_acyclic(_Config) ->
  165:     Tasks = get_or_generate_tasks(100_000, 3, false),
  166:     Input = #{<<"tasks">> => Tasks},
  167:     ct:pal("Generated Tasks List of length ~p~n", [length(Tasks)]),
  168:     Start = os:timestamp(),
  169:     Result = jobforge_job:process(Input),
  170:     End = os:timestamp(),
  171:     ElapsedMicroSecs = timer:now_diff(End, Start),
  172:     ElapsedMillis = ElapsedMicroSecs div 1000,
  173:     ct:pal("Time taken: ~pms~n", [ElapsedMillis]),
  174:     case Result of
  175:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  176:         _ -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Result})
  177:     end.
  178: 
  179: get_or_generate_tasks(N, MaxDeps, AllowCycles) ->
  180:     TmpDir = "/Users/gurwinder/Documents/Sort-Commands/jobforge/tmp",
  181:     ok = ensure_tmp_dir(TmpDir),
  182:     FileName = filename:join(TmpDir, io_lib:format("tasks_N~p_D~p_C~p.json", [N, MaxDeps, AllowCycles])),
  183:     case file:read_file(FileName) of
  184:         {ok, Bin} ->
  185:             io:format("Loaded tasks from cache: ~s~n", [FileName]),
  186:             jsx:decode(Bin, [return_maps]);
  187:         {error, _} ->
  188:             io:format("Generating new tasks and saving to: ~s~n", [FileName]),
  189:             Tasks = generate_tasks(N, MaxDeps, AllowCycles),
  190:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, jsx:encode(Tasks)),
  191:             Tasks
  192:     end.
  193: 
  194: ensure_tmp_dir(Dir) ->
  195:     case file:read_file_info(Dir) of
  196:         {ok, Info} when Info#file_info.type =:= directory -> ok;
  197:         {ok, _} -> {error, not_a_directory};
  198:         {error, _} -> file:make_dir(Dir)
  199:     end.
  200: 
  201: generate_tasks(N, MaxDeps, AllowCycles) ->
  202:     TaskNames = [<<"task-", (integer_to_binary(I))/binary>> || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  203:     Tasks = [generate_task(I, TaskNames, MaxDeps, AllowCycles, N) || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
  204:     io:format("~nDone generating ~p tasks.~n", [N]),
  205:     Tasks.
  206: 
  207: generate_task(I, TaskNames, MaxDeps, AllowCycles, N) ->
  208:     if I rem 1000 =:= 0; I =:= N ->
  209:         io:format("\rGenerated ~p/~p tasks (~p%)", [I, N, (I*100) div N]);
  210:        true -> ok
  211:     end,
  212:     Name = lists:nth(I, TaskNames),
  213:     Command = <<"echo Task ", (integer_to_binary(I))/binary>>,
  214:     Candidates =
  215:         case AllowCycles of
  216:             true -> TaskNames -- [Name];
  217:             false -> lists:sublist(TaskNames, I-1)
  218:         end,
  219:     NumDeps = if Candidates =:= [] -> 0; true -> rand:uniform(min(MaxDeps, length(Candidates)) + 1) - 1 end,
  220:     Requires = random_deps_fast(Candidates, NumDeps),
  221:     #{<<"name">> => Name, <<"command">> => Command, <<"requires">> => Requires}.
  222: 
  223: random_deps_fast(_Candidates, 0) -> [];
  224: random_deps_fast(Candidates, Num) when Num > 0 ->
  225:     Indices = random_indices(length(Candidates), Num, sets:new()),
  226:     [lists:nth(I, Candidates) || I <- Indices].
  227: 
  228: random_indices(_Len, 0, Acc) -> sets:to_list(Acc);
  229: random_indices(Len, N, Acc) ->
  230:     I = rand:uniform(Len),
  231:     case sets:is_element(I, Acc) of
  232:         true -> random_indices(Len, N, Acc);
  233:         false -> random_indices(Len, N-1, sets:add_element(I, Acc))
  234:     end.
